body:
CC @nathanielmanistaatgoogle  (feel free to review, but it actually doesn't touch the python code and I assigned Michael so you can focus on other python issues).

FYI @hsaliak @ctiller

Here's the output of one test run using python3 (about 50% of test cases are failing).


(1) Please keep @thunderboltsid looped into all Python 3.x-related work.

(2) There's "one" Python 2.x and that is 2.7 ([one opinion](http://www.snarky.ca/stop-using-python-2-6), [another opinion](http://www.curiousefficiency.org/posts/2015/04/stop-supporting-python26.html)), but there's more than one 3.x: 3.3 can be considered out of date, but both 3.4 and 3.5 are current enough. Can we do both 3.4 and 3.5? How about in-development 3.6?

@nathanielmanistaatgoogle   we can certainly add  python 3.5 and 3.6 (run_tests.py allows doing that pretty easily, but we would need to update our docker images), but let's do things one at a time. Once we have 3.4 working, adding 3.5 should be much easier.
